secText: You may be familiar with the concept of density, but since it is a concept we use often, we will review it here.

Density is the ratio of the mass of an object to its volume.  A material like lead has relatively high density, much greater than that of balsa wood.  Density is a property of a material and is independent of the size of an object. For example, the density of water in a swimming pool is the same as the density of water in a teacup. In contrast, the mass and weight of an object depend not only on the type of matter, but on how much matter is present.
Density is represented by the Greek letter ρ, pronounced “rho,” and is measured in kilograms per cubic meter.
